keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats execute Usopp's plan to split into teams and retrieve their confiscated gold and waver
keyEvents.significance: Central location for the episode's main conflict and strategic maneuvering

keyEvents.description: Vice Admiral Jonathan sets up an ambush at the vault to trap the gold retrieval team
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the fortress's security and Jonathan's control over the base

geography.terrain: A massive fortified marine base built into and around a mountain, surrounded by water with defensive rock cliffs

description: G-8 is a heavily fortified Marine base commanded by Vice Admiral Jonathan. It is one of the largest Marine installations in Paradise, featuring extensive facilities including a vault, medical wing, docks, and various administrative buildings. The base is enclosed by defensive walls and cliffs, making entry and exit extremely difficult.

keyEvents.description: Usopp successfully picks the complex lock mechanism on the vault door
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's technical skills and sets up the trap discovery

keyEvents.description: The gold retrieval team discovers the vault is empty - Jonathan had moved the gold to his quarters
keyEvents.significance: Reveals Jonathan's tactical foresight and adds a twist to the heist attempt

keyEvents.description: Marines spring Jonathan's trap, surrounding the gold retrieval team
keyEvents.significance: Creates immediate danger for Luffy, Zoro, Usopp, and Robin

geography.terrain: Heavily secured vault room within G-8 Marine Base

description: The vault is a high-security storage facility within the G-8 Marine Base, protected by a complex locking mechanism. It was expected to house the Straw Hats' confiscated Skypiea gold, but Vice Admiral Jonathan anticipated the theft attempt and moved the treasure elsewhere, using the vault as bait for an ambush.
